title: Wow. "Dynamic queue reduces toxity" is a big fat lie.
body:
Lyte shoved down our throats "statistics" that players really really want to play with friends.  Other rioters said it reduced toxity. I bring you an old post: 

http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=4639545&page=1#post48085298
From riot himself. From Lyte the designer of dynamic queue. It is a big fat lie.

"One of the things about voice chat is that more often than not, you end up with games where only a few of the players opt into the application, and the rest are still using text. In our analysis, we found that ***text-based communication in games where only some of the teammates were in voice chat***  had up to 126% more racism, sexism, homophobia, and verbal abuse that we all agree have no place in League.

And that's , for you guys, is the current situation of dynamic queue. 4 man premades and a solo punch bag. ***126%*** MORE toxicity.

And it gets better: 

Not surprisingly, we also saw that players who were using voice chat with strangers received ***47% more reports than your baseline League player***.

And that's the FUTURE of league. 47% more reports.

Sadly Lyte left, provably because he could endure the "shove dynamic queues up their a**es" tencent order. 

Any red care to answer? Two possible answers: 
1) Riot is lying. Dynamic queue is a cash grab before the game dies.
2) Lyte was lying when he first posted about voice chat. If that's the case he should have the chance to defend himself. 

Probably this post will be ignored.
I don't have a reddit acc, if anyone cares to post this here it would be a bless.

replies.body:
Well, you shouldn't try to confirm/infirm something from Riot with something from Riot.
They rarely publish anything correct when it's mathematically/statistically related.
-
By the way, from what I saw in near diamond games, it reduced toxicity in won games (everyone got his role, and everything is going well => no flame), but increased it in lose games (you got your main role, but you're losing with it), leading to worse consequences ie losing the whole game.
That's  the new champion select, not DQ.

> [{quoted}](name=Keevalroy,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=UNOEA2H5,comment-id=00020001,timestamp=2016-07-01T11:48:24.832+0000)
>
> That's  the new champion select, not DQ.

They are the same thing.

http://i.imgur.com/upZzCwu.png[/img]

They are _not_ the same thing. Dynamic Queue allows premades to sign up for ranked together.  The new champion select allows you to sign up for specific roles. I don't understand how after all this time it's still confusing people.

They're separate entities that Riot fit into one update and considers them the same since it will help muddy the results of their DQ support data collection to make it seem more welcome than it really is.

> [{quoted}](name=Keevalroy,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=UNOEA2H5,comment-id=0002000100000000,timestamp=2016-07-01T11:59:23.252+0000)
>
> They are _not_ the same thing. Dynamic Queue allows premades to sign up for ranked together.  The new champion select allows you to sign up for specific roles. I don't understand how after all this time it's still confusing people.
> 
> They're separate entities that Riot fit into one update and considers them the same since it will help muddy the results of their DQ support data collection to make it seem more welcome than it really is.

As far as Riot's concerned they are the same thing. And their opinion is the only one that matters.
Let's not use our brains at all. Let's allow the benevolent rulers to think for us since they would never lie to us or lead us astray...

> [{quoted}](name=Keevalroy,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=UNOEA2H5,comment-id=000200010000000000000000,timestamp=2016-07-01T12:13:19.870+0000)
>
> Let's not use our brains at all. Let's allow the benevolent rulers to think for us since they would never lie to us or lead us astray...

They're the ones programming the game.

If DQ and new champ select are "the same" then we're never going to get a new solo queue with new champ select.

"Using my brain" has nothing to do with it.

people tell you they are different because......
it is in the real of possibility to have the old solo+duoq back and the new champ select
even a soloq with the new champ select

and that in no way, shape or form is the new champ select restricted in usage by the new dynamicq system (queue up with 5 people).

Like, the "wheel" (champ select) is part of a car (dynamic queue). And you can move the "wheel" (champ select) to other cars (other queues). Therefore, they are separate things.
"The majority of the League of Legends ~~community~~ sheeple favour Dynamic Queue over Solo Queue"

> [{quoted}](name=Keevalroy,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=UNOEA2H5,comment-id=0002000100000000,timestamp=2016-07-01T11:59:23.252+0000)
>
> They are _not_ the same thing. Dynamic Queue allows premades to sign up for ranked together.  The new champion select allows you to sign up for specific roles. I don't understand how after all this time it's still confusing people.
> 
> They're separate entities that Riot fit into one update and considers them the same since it will help muddy the results of their DQ support data collection to make it seem more welcome than it really is.

I think what he means is Riot can't magically remove one and keep the other because they were written with code that supports each other.

I think i should clarify what i think the rioter means. When they coded the new champion select they intertwined it with dynamic queue. With the way it is written one cannot exist without the other at this point in time. In order to separate the two it would require entirely rewriting the code for the champion select, the match making formula, and many other smaller things that we wouldn't know about. It would require an immense amount of time, money, and man power. That cost wouldn't be worth it for what is overall a rather insignificant change. But there is a silver lining, they are experimenting now while they are building the new client. With that new client comes a clean slate and an opportunity to improve their ability to respond to community feedback, as well as implement things they've wanted to for a long time but have been held back because of their outdated system.
My guess is that with the old client things are written in a way that makes it very difficult for the programmers to go in and change things. If the are smart with the new client they will make it so changes are much more easily made end everything is able to exist individually without the reliance on other parts of the code. So keep you head up and i think Riot will really take leaps forward with the new client.

Yeah, right.

And because they are "the same thing", at the start of the season **we could play soloqueue, but with new champ select**, because the DynQ matchmaking algorithm bugged out and they had to deactivate it for several days :D

> [{quoted}](name=franticFurball,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=UNOEA2H5,comment-id=0002000100000005,timestamp=2016-07-02T00:46:02.069+0000)
>

......Did you even play it? Because it wasn't new champ select. When they did that it was old draft with pick order. Source: I actually played when that happened.
Yes, I played it. And what I just said was what actually happened :)

> [{quoted}](name=franticFurball,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=UNOEA2H5,comment-id=000200010000000500000000,timestamp=2016-07-02T07:49:35.295+0000)
>
> Yes, I played it. And what I just said was what actually happened :)

Maybe on EUW? idk man. NA had the old solo/duo with pick order.

I play on EUW, and that doesn't matter.

Your statement from the above post:

> [{quoted}](name=That Evelynn,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=UNOEA2H5,comment-id=000200010000,timestamp=2016-07-01T11:50:56.337+0000)
>
> They are the same thing.


The fact that we were able to play in a soloQ configuration WITH THE NEW CHAMP SELECT, proves conclusively that they are not the same thing, and not dependend on one another.

I feel exactly the same (probably that's because we play on the same server, don't know).
I'm a mid-gold level player, my matches are typically between G5 and P5 mmr (win/loss streaks). In G5 there is a bit more toxicity because Silver is a mess of a league imo, then in it gets exactly as you described. 
When I'm winning with solos, it feels the best, we are communicating via pings and in chat. Jokes, cheers and overall a positive experience. 
When I'm winning with premades, it's a CoOp vs Advanced AI game. I'm playing a solo game with 3-4 silent teammates. And you don't normally flame bots.
But LOSING this season is an absolutely horrible experience. I feel there is much more flame in losing games. Hate, cancer wishes, death wishes, and then some. Season 5 was better. Season 4 and earlier - probably not.

Lyte's statistics about voice communication are complete garbage.
Especially once he calls upon "think of the wymyns"
All of Lyte's statistics were total bullshit, and manipulated to fit the message he wanted to communicate.

> [{quoted}](name=MrWasjig,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=UNOEA2H5,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2016-07-01T12:02:47.375+0000)
>
> All of Lyte's statistics were total bullshit, and manipulated to fit the message he wanted to communicate.

I am pretty sure at 10000% what you said is correct.

Nah you're totally 11/10 wrong 
{{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}

> [{quoted}](name=MrWasjig,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=UNOEA2H5,comment-id=0000000000000000,timestamp=2016-07-01T12:09:48.107+0000)
>
> Nah you're totally 11/10 wrong 
> {{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}

I am 10^6 ppm right =)
More like, potentially n% correct :D

Toxicity is still here.

Its just more directed.

At people outside premades.

Y'know cause no one wants to blame the challenger/master/diamond carrying them up the ranks lmao.

Edit: Also its my firm belief that dynamic queue is bad for friendships

Playing with friends is great and all... However, when there is something to gain or lose for each individual (i.e. LP or MMR), there **will** be more tension when one of those "friends" or yourself makes a mistake that costs you a game or at least makes it harder to win the game.

They can say "Its fine" or "Its Okay" all they want, but inside they're thinking "why are you doing this to me?"

That ain't healthy for relationships.

But thats my own opinion. I'm sure others feel differently.

There is nothing, _nothing_, that the game developers can do to ultimately overcome the problem of "toxicity".

This has been a problem since very early in the game's design, and it existed far before League. Hence, it existed before solo queues / duo queues, and it exists afterwards.

It will go on and continue until _we_ learn how to overcome it as individuals, on an _individual basis_, by ourselves or with by the grace of good, rational sense that others have put up over and over again.

We have to learn how to _remain calm_ and let those things roll off of _our_ backs. No excuse. No "But!". It's the only, _only_ way.

If you are doing nothing in your own individual matches to make "toxicity" powerless, then it will always exist. Because it is nothing that any simple video game developers can solve. It is human psychology - the actual, age old struggle since the beginning of our mankind's history between one initial prick and the guy who gets pissed off and shouts back, so that there are then 2 pricks - who then go on to endlessly infect others with prick-itude until there are over 7 billion pricks living on Earth.

It happens on the streets of New York, it happens in homes, it happens in League. As individuals we have to be the solution, each one of us healing and recovering from our prick-itude one at a time.

Couldn't have said it better. We have the tools to get rid of toxicity by reporting. Yes it is very hard to win with a feeder or troll on your team, but it isn't impossible. And at the end of the game, if everyone does their part by reporting, that troll will likely get some form of punishment compared to just one or two people reporting. But everyone needs to report, including the winning team.

I think most of us share the experience of winning a game because someone on the enemy team flamed or fed and you left the lobby right away. Fighting that habit and ensuring you report is something we all have to do. Sounds cliche but theoretically if everyone did this then every troll would be gone pretty fast. 

overall: just remember to report, despite which team you are on. And don't let it get to your head
SO your solution to the "people are dicks" issue is to rely on a plan that depends on people to NOT be dicks...

It's to stop being a dick and report people that are still dicks, thus ridding people that are being dicks. But people have to report. Wishful thinking but in actuality that's the solution that would have the best result overall.
As usual, though, human nature kinda rules out the best solutions.

**Before** "if you dont pick support I report you!" or "you are last pick so you support"

**Now** everyone plays whatever they want except the fillers. I think it did alot. At least thats with the new Champ Select
That's the new champion select, not Dynamic Queue.

I've been playing DQ since its been active and I rarely see toxic behavior in my games, so it might be doing something right.

Also please stop using buzzwords you have no idea what it means. If so then please tell me how DQ is a "cash grab" seeing as how nothing in it has to be paid for by us player!

> [{quoted}](name=Sarutobi,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=UNOEA2H5,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2016-07-01T09:25:58.536+0000)

What buzzword? Cash grab?
Oh boy... you don't know how a "free to play" game works right?
Care to talk about herd mentality, peer pressure and the consumptions of skins/boxes(RNG)? 

http://www.apa.org/monitor/jun04/driving.aspx 
http://www.gamasutra.com/view/feature/195806/chasing_the_whale_examining_the_.php?print=1

Sure I don't know S**t about what I'm saying! Do I need to keep going?
Every post about dynamic queue is part of the herd mentality. But let's not talk about that.
If it was herd mentality, people wouldn't bother putting up valid statements and do their own research for most posts. It would just be like "DQ is shit man, we want SQ!" and nothing else.
well, in essence, essentially every part of every game is a "Cashgrab"

> Sadly Lyte left,

No, not really.

> Probably this post will be ignored.

Yep, it will be. Anything related with solo/"dynamic" is ignored.

> I don't have a reddit acc, if anyone cares to post this here it would be a bless.

I heard admins in reddit delete ANYTHING related to solo/"dynamic" as to not provoke players into thinking.


Cause you know.. idiots are easier to steer.

>I heard admins in reddit delete ANYTHING related to solo/"dynamic" as to not provoke players into thinking.

More that they can't bear the thought of something "anti-Riot" showing up in their paradise of praise and esports drama.  The simple thought of their policed forums turning on the Riot gods meant to be worshiped drives them crazy, so almost literally everything negative is auto-deleted.
Remember where it popped up the mods there had NDA's signed with Riot. Just shows you that Riot controls that reddit as well.

Note that these stats refer to voice chat with random strangers, not with friends.

> Not surprisingly, we also saw that players who were using voice chat **with strangers** received 47% more reports than your baseline League player.

> Many players already use voice chat like Skype and Ventrilo **with their friends and that's awesome**. But, a system that automatically or easily puts you into voice chat **with strangers** leads to 126% more toxicity and 47% more reports even when players can opt-out of the experience or mute each other.

Actually, the stats don't state that. 

The 126% increase of toxicity is just stating it is where people are in voice chat and some aren't. That is exactly where we are with DQ. DOES NOT SAY WITH STRANGERS.

The 47% more reports with strangers needs more detailed information before it can actually mean anything. For example, what were the reports for and are they accurate. If people are being reported by strangers accurately, it shows that those people aren't being reported due to playing with other toxic players/premades. If they are false reports, their future reports hold less weight.

They only looked at voice chat with strangers.

> But, a system that automatically or easily puts you into **voice chat with strangers leads to 126% more toxicity and 47% more reports** even when players can opt-out of the experience or mute each other.

Duh?

You don't really believe anything this company tells the players do you?

After 6 straight seasons of lying about anything and everything?

i thnk the problem with that statement in the first place is, that its difficult to determine if toxicity in this game was actually reduced by dynamic que or new champ select.

one of the largest issues of the game when solo que still existed was people fighting over roles and pick order in the old champ select. it put a lot of people on tilt before getting into a game.

imo this is actually the largest factor that truly reduced toxicity. imo the new champ select still has flaws. for example i dont see a reason why it shouldnt be optional to pick a 3rd role or 4th role for people who are okay with playing multiple different roles. (optional being the word here), and the current issues with the support role being starved, hence fill = support.

but dynamic que if anything generally only increased toxicity. maybe not neccessarily in chat alone. but the way games are often focused around that 3 or 4 man premade right now that doesnt communicate at all with its solo players, unless its to bash him.

i think if solo que existed like before, with the new champ select they would have also noticed the same drop in toxicity.

Oooooooor here's the real answer:
1. The experiment you quoted was specifically between players who were randomly queued together, NOT when playing with friends (A.K.A what dynamic queue is). Meaning there is ZERO relevance between the two pieces of data you're comparing. 

So please, actually think about where the data comes from before you try to make massive assumptions and lead others in the boards astray. And there are 2 major problems with your post overall:
1. You make massive assumptions with no basis even from the statistics, such as Riot using Dynamic queue as a "cash grab" and that the game is dying. Both of those are false so please just shut the hell up.
2. You claim the first set of statistics are false and made up, then use another set from Riot to make your claim, which doesn't even make sense.

The game is kind of dying; there's actual statistics that show this. The stats that Riot gave are propaganda because premades are less likely to report each other thus less frequencies or volumes of reports overall but those who are not part of premades are now prone to bullying, reports, etc just for not being part of the premade. This was the reason why Riot refused to implement Dynamic Queue like system in the past as they said for years but all of a sudden they go back on that word and people are openly being hazed by premades in their own team. Hextech boxes? Gamble style RP money grab? Appealing to casual players who might spend couple of bucks but leave after a few months? C'mon. The signs are all there.
I think a rioter said on some post (can't remember what post) that the statistics for reports were based on games that had a report in them rather than the amount of reports in a game.

I wasn't referring to amount of reports per game either; I am aware that the stats were based off games that had report in them rather than the quantity in them. Sorry if what I wrote was misleading or gave off that implication.
Don't expect a Rioter to comment on this. They usually only comment on stupid meme threads. Nothing important like this

The fact that partial voice chat increases toxicity does not prove that DQ increases toxicity, for 2 reasons.

1. Some people use premades without voice chat.
2. Even among premades in DQ who use voice chat, it could increase toxicity because of that, and still reduce it for other reasons, and the net result could be a decrease in toxicity. You don't have a strict equivalence between "partial voice chat" and "DQ".

Nice try, but try again.
